awd_titl_txt: REU:  Undergraduate Research Experiences in High Pressure   Geophysics
awd_abstract_narration: 9721374  Weidner         This project establishes a summer program which will allow  undergraduates the opportunity to participate in the excitement of  working in a premier science laboratory.  The goal of the program  is to recruit students from the physical sciences with the hope  that they will be stimulated to the point of pursuing a research  career in the Earth Sciences.  Students in this program will work  with faculty members of the Mineral Physics Institute on projects  which probe the physical and chemical properties of materials with  a particular emphasis on the use of high pressure.  Working closely  with members of the MPI, students will pursue their own projects  and discuss their progress during weekly seminar sessions.  During  the program, students will visit other laboratories and  institutions affiliated with the Mineral Physics Institute.  ***

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
